paper_abstract: Service matchmaking in a distributed environment has been an active research issue for some time now. This paper discusses the problem of matchmaking for visualization web services, gives a unified visualization service description model to depict the services' basic properties, functional and non-functional properties, and proposes a matchmaking framework for visualization services discovery which is based on the ontology defined and permits user to specify his QoS request in order to get "good" visualization services. Meanwhile, a proof of concept is done with a prototype implementation, and a qualitative analysis and a quantitative test of the prototype system are given to evaluate its performance.
paper_title: Matchmaking framework for visualization web services
